boardgame.description: This 18xx game takes the basic mechanics from Tresham's 1829 and adds several new elements. Players seek to make the most money by buying and selling stock in various rail companies located on a German map. The board itself is actually a fairly abstract hexagonal system, with track tiles placed on top of the hexes. Players buy and sell stock in various share companies, whose actions are controlled by the majority stockholder. The stock manipulation aspect of the game is not as brutal as in 1830. Plus each 18xx title adds new and different elements to the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This game features minor rail companies, layered stock offerings, and the formation of the Prussian railroad from the minor companies. A game is finished when the bank runs out of money, and the player with the greatest personal holdings wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Original description: The box has seen better days - The top has shelf-wear and the bottom is curved (not obvious for the eye, but you can definitly feel it). I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the second owner of this game and I have never played this game. I can only guess what the previous owner did with his copy, but I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t think he played it much if I look at the quality of the paper money. All the cards (share certificates,…) and tokens look new to me. The gameboard has a little bit of wear in the top part. The version is from Hans im Gluck (a german publisher), but on the inside I only find rules in English and no rules in German. The Share Price Index has the two languages on it. The reference card for the various phases is in German. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve counted 147 hexagonal tiles, 68 share certificates, 6 private railway certificates, 33 train cards, 8 large charters and 6 small charters as noted in the rulebook. The amount of tokens isn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t mentioned, but looking at the available photo_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s on BGG this also looks complete. (being the second owner I wanted to check this to be shure). Components = nearly new, box = not great but OK. On the photo_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s on BGG I can see a wooden traintoken for the first player. In this box it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a red cilinder. I hope this gives enough information, but if there are still some questions, do not hesitate to ask them. Payment via Bank Transfer (EU) or paypal (world)
